alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 4:37PM MST until August 13 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, western Pima. * WHEN...Until 745 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms near and around Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument. This will cause small stream flooding. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Alamo Wash, San Cristobal Wash, Cuerda de Lena, Growler Wash, Gu Vo Wash, Kuakatch Wash, Ali Chuk Wash, Aguajita Wash, Pia Oik Wash, and Gunsight Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gu Vo, Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument, Why, Pia Oik, Kuakatch and Lukeville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
